body_html: Ah, sorry for not reading carefully. You're correct that (as far as I know) there's no easy way to do that in current tensorflow. According to someone more knowledgeable than I, people generally do such contractive autoencoders by writing out the first derivative manually. Also, they generally restrict to single layer at a time networks for speed issues, since doing the full Jacobian for a multilayer network is quite expensive.
